version_a.description: Fixed version with minimal changes to address the vulnerability

functions.name: addLiquidity
functions.vulnerability: Uses average of ratios instead of minimum for LP unit calculation

ground_truth.root_cause: addLiquidity used average of ratios instead of minimum. Formula: (baseRatio + tokenRatio) / 2 instead of min(baseRatio, tokenRatio). This broke the fundamental AMM invariant that LP tokens should represent proportional ownership.
ground_truth.attack_vector: 1) Pool: 100 BASE, 100 TOKEN, 100 totalUnits. 2) Attacker adds 1 BASE + 99 TOKEN (heavily imbalanced). 3) baseRatio = 1*100/100 = 1, tokenRatio = 99*100/100 = 99. 4) BUG: liquidityUnits = (1+99)/2 = 50 (should be min(1,99) = 1!). 5) Attacker got 50 units for only 1 BASE worth of value. 6) Removes liquidity: gets 33 BASE + 33 TOKEN. 7) Net profit per cycle. 8) Repeated to drain $30M.
